original_claim: ctor was found alongside Betsy Arakawa and their dog at their home in New Mexico yesterday.
perplexity_response: The claim is **partially supported**. Gene Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, were indeed found dead at their home in New Mexico, along with one of their dogs. However, the claim specifies that this occurred "yesterday," which may not align with the actual timeline of the discovery, as the bodies were found on Wednesday, February 27, 2025, during a welfare check[1][3][4]. The investigation is ongoing, and foul play is not suspected at this time[1][2].

citations.evidence: "Legendary actor Gene Hackman, 95, and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, 64, and their dog were found dead in their home outside Santa Fe, authorities say."
"The couple were found dead, along with one of their dogs, Wednesday in their home in the southwestern U.S. state of New Mexico."
"Legendary actor Gene Hackman and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, were found dead in their home in New Mexico Wednesday afternoon, ABC News has confirmed."
"An investigation is underway after actor Gene Hackman, 95, and his wife, Betsy Arakawa, 65, were mysteriously found dead alongside a dog in their Santa Fe, New Mexico, home, authorities said."

original_claim: In the city a short time ago the FTSE 100 was trading up 24 points at 87.56.
perplexity_response: The claim is **not supported**. The FTSE 100 index values reported in recent sources do not match the claim of trading at 87.56. Typically, the FTSE 100 index values are in the thousands, not below 100. For example, recent reports show the FTSE 100 trading around 8,800 points[1][3][5]. There is no evidence to suggest that the FTSE 100 has ever traded at such a low value as 87.56.

original_claim: a so-called documentary on Gaza that wasn't wholly open about who was in it nor what they said will hear from an Israeli government spokesperson plus make broccoli great again just massive Brock news actually in the making of part of the campaign to sell 10,000 tons of broccoli a month and part of making it go viral we will have a serious player in making good food unbelievably good looking joining the campaign and what's up message now 0345 606 0973 text 84850 Tom Swalbrick on LBC very good afternoon to you first in the next 60 minutes the transatlantic alliance faces its stiffest
perplexity_response: The claim that a documentary on Gaza was not wholly open about who was in it nor what they said is partially supported. The documentary, "Gaza: How to Survive a War Zone," was criticized for featuring a narrator who is the son of a Hamas official, which was not initially disclosed by the BBC[1][2][4]. However, the documentary itself does provide context about the narrator's family background and includes official Israeli Army justifications for their actions, suggesting some level of transparency within the film[1]. The controversy surrounding the documentary's removal from the BBC's streaming service highlights concerns about its content and presentation[2][3].

citations.evidence: "The BBC claimed it had been made aware only after the broadcast that its narrator who you can see on screen here a 13-year-old Palestinian boy Abdullah yzui that he was the son of a former agricultural minister of the Palestinian government in Gaza... Abdullah the child narrator repeatedly reads Out official Israeli Army justifications every time there's an act of Israeli violence shown on screen."
"The film was removed after the BBC said it discovered the film's 14-year-old narrator was the son of an official for Palestinian organisation Hamas."
"The storm over its Gaza documentary just got a whole lot worse. As if it wasn’t bad enough that this Israel-mauling hour of TV was fronted by the son of a leading member of Hamas."

original_claim: Minister Stammer's announcement to increase spending to 2.5% which is obviously good news however the president does continue to urge our NATO allies to increase spending to 2.5% it's nowhere near enough that's the message coming from the White House in the last few minutes Tom.
perplexity_response: The claim is partially supported. It is accurate that Prime Minister Keir Starmer has announced an increase in UK defense spending to 2.5% of GDP by 2027, which aligns with NATO's spending targets[1][2][3]. However, the assertion that this is "nowhere near enough" according to the White House is not explicitly supported by the provided sources. While it is true that President Trump has urged NATO allies to increase their defense spending, there is no direct quote or statement from the White House in the sources indicating that 2.5% is insufficient[1][2].

original_claim: Test drive one of our award-winning models and you'll enjoy up to £1,000 off your new CUPRA in addition to existing offers.
perplexity_response: The claim is **partially supported**. The CUPRA Drive Event indeed offers discounts of up to £1,000 on new CUPRA models when ordered by March 31st, 2025, and delivered by June 30th, 2025, in addition to existing offers[1][3][5]. However, the specific discount amount varies by model, with some models like the CUPRA Born and Tavascan receiving an additional £500 off, while others like the Formentor, Leon, and Ateca receive an additional £1,000 off[1][3][5].

citations.evidence: "Test drive one of our captivating CUPRA models and you can enjoy up to £1,000 off in addition to existing offers."
"Until March 31st 2025, get between £500 and £1,000 off a new CUPRA."
"Until March 31st 2025, get between £500 and £1,000 off a new CUPRA^."
